communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NFLIS Reports on Deoxymethoxetamine (3'-methyl-2-oxo-PCE, DMXE, 3D-MXE)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This request is for the release of any drug reports compiled by the NFLIS (National Forensic Laboratory Information System) regarding Deoxymethoxetamine (3'-methyl-2-oxo-PCE, DMXE, 3D-MXE).

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deoxymethoxetamine

According to the September 2024 NFLIS-Drug bulletin, Deoxymethoxetamine was reported by a lab in the state Maryland to the National Forensic Laboratory Information System for the first time in 2024. The drug, publicly identified by the government as a hallucinogen, was reported to the DEA's NFLIS sometime between January 1st 2024 and September 30th 2024. A copy of the September 2024 NFLIS-Drug bulletin that mentions Deoxmethoxetamine should be attached to this request. 

This is a request for any documents, reports, memorandum, or anything that could reasonably be construed as "relevant documents" related to Deoxmethoxetamine created by the NFLIS during this period. Please conduct a search any "evaluations for scheduling" or "recommendations for scheduling" or "reports to NFLIS" or "reports from NFLIS" regarding Deoxymethoxetamine aka "3'-methyl-2-oxo-PCE", "DMXE" and "3D-MXE".

If the Drug Enforcement Agency cannot fulfill certain parts of this request or certain portions must be redacted please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed.

Thank you for the Drug Enforcement Agency's commitment to transparency, and I look forward to working together until this request is resolved.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

- 417 N 7th St, St Peter, MN 56082

communications.subject: South Dakota Open Records Law Request: Cybercheck comms and contracts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Dakota Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents since Jan. 1, 2021 between Sioux Falls Police Department and Global Intelligence Inc. (also called Cybercheck or Cybercheck.AI) for the provision of the Cybercheck service.

2. All email exchanges, including attachments, between Sioux Falls Police Department staff and email addresses with the domain "@cybercheck.ai" between Jan. 1, 2021 and the present.

3. All emails, including attachments, between staff of Sioux Falls Police Department that reference Cybercheck or its provider Global Intelligence, sent between Jan. 1, 2021 and the present.

I kindly request that you waive all fees as I am a journalist and the requested records will be used for journalism in the public interest.

If you choose to impose fees, I request a detailed breakdown of the fees, including the hourly wage of each employee involved and an explanation of the employee hours required to fulfil the request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Location: North Avenue Beach, Chicago, Illinois

Incident Summary: Bodycam footage captures a confrontation between Brown and a CPD officer after she was instructed to leave the closed beach area. The interaction escalated into a physical struggle, during which the officer attempted to detain Brown. The Civilian Office of Police Accountability (COPA) has since launched an investigation into the officer’s actions.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Engaged with Nikkita Brown at North Avenue Beach.
Were present during the altercation and physical struggle.
Recorded Brown’s interaction, including audio before, during, and after the encounter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Chongya Weldon Arrest

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Chongya Weldon Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: September 20, 2024
Individual Involved: Chongya Weldon
Incident Summary: Officers arrested Weldon at her home following allegations that she threw water on a plant shop owner on September 14, 2024. Bodycam footage reportedly captures the interaction between officers and Weldon, including her objections to the arrest and accusations that officers used excessive force. Weldon was charged with resisting an officer.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to Weldon’s residence on September 20, 2024.
Interacted with Weldon during her arrest.
Transported Weldon following her arrest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.subject: PRA Request :: P017454-022525
communications.communication:
Dear Harun Harun: Thank you for your interest in public records of the Long Beach Police Department. Your request has been received and will be processed in the order it was received. Your request was received in this office on 2/25/2025 and given the reference number P017454-022525 for tracking purposes. The Public Records (PRA) division does NOT process Police Reports, Arrest Reports or Subpoenas. These requests must be submitted to the Information Management (IM) division: https://www.longbeach.gov/police/how-do-i/request-a-police-report/ The IM division report request helpline is (562) 570-7381. If your PRA requests such records, it will be closed upon receipt. Pursuant to California Government Code § 7922.535, staff will review your request and respond within 10 days to notify you if there are responsive records, or if an extension is necessary to determine if responsive records exist. If your request was received after business hours or on a weekend or holiday, the next business day will be considered the date of receipt. The 10-day response period starts with the first calendar day after the date of receipt (Ca. Civ. Code, § 10.). 
 
 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Long Beach Police Department Request Center.

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Volusia County Sheriff's Office,

I am writing to formally request access to the bodycam footage under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) related to the assault on a school resource officer at Deltona Middle School on 11/1/2024.

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: 11/1/2024
Location: Deltona Middle School, Deltona, Florida
Suspects: Jorge Rivera (46) and Dagmarie Aponte Iturrino (45)
Incident Summary: The suspects, parents of a student, allegedly attacked and punched a school resource officer after a dispute over their son being charged with battery. The officer was shoved, punched in the face, and suffered a concussion during the altercation.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who responded to the scene and interacted with the suspects during the incident and arrest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Use of MRAP vehicle (Prosper Police Department)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Use of MRAP vehicle (Prosper Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Prosper Police Department procured a Mine-Resistant Ambush Protected (MRAP) vehicle that was obtained through the Federal 1033 program. On June 1, 2024, their Facebook account invited the public to view the vehicle. Here is a news article on this event. 
https://www.nbcdfw.com/news/local/prosper-police-departments-emergency-vehicle/3560134/

I am requesting all recorded uses of this MRAP vehicle and any other vehicles that have been obtained through the Federal 1033 program. This included uses by both Prosper and Collin County's police/sheriff departments. It was mentioned in new reporting that the vehicle can help neighboring communities in Collin County. This request includes an use of the vehicle for community engagement, like the news article, and uses for emergency rescues. If this vehicle was used in other counties, please include their uses of the vehicle.

I request that I be properly classified as a news media requester. I am an investigative researcher for Bellingcat, and I am requesting this information in that capacity and request that fees be waived for this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kolina Koltai

communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Complete FOIA logs from November 9, 2024 through December 31, 2024 (inclusive of those dates).

Name of requestor,

title: Subject: Request for Body-worn Camera Footage: Name Withheld (August 18, 2023)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Subject: Request for Body-worn Camera Footage: Name Withheld (August 18, 2023)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All unedited body-worn camera / bodycam recordings related to the following law enforcement critical incident: 

Incident Date: August 18, 2023  
Location: I-75 and Vernor Highway, Detroit, MI  
Victim Name: Name Withheld  

I am specifically requesting the unedited body-worn camera recordings captured by all officers present for the full duration of the incident, including audio recordings associated with the footage.  

If any portion of the requested footage must be redacted, I ask that you clearly indicate the portions that have been redacted and provide an explanation of the legal basis for the redactions. If the requested footage is withheld in its entirety, please provide a detailed explanation citing relevant public records exemption(s).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jeffrey Lamson

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Subject: Request for Body-worn Camera Footage: Name Withheld (August 18, 2023)
communications.communication:
This email serves as the City of Detroit’s response to the above-referenced matter. Your request was received at the City of Detroit Law Department Freedom of Information Act Section via facsimile or email, on February 25, 2025. Because your request was received by electronic transmission, pursuant to Section 5(1) of the Michigan Freedom of Information Act (the “Act”), MCL 15.235(1); it is deemed to have been received at the Law Department on the next business day, February 26, 2025.

Pursuant to Section 5(2) of the Act, MCL 15.235(2), the City’s response is due within five (5) business days. However, due to the nature and the scope of your request and the volume of the requests received by the City, we are extending the City’s response deadline by ten (10) additional business days in accordance with Section 5(2) (d) of the Act, MCL 15.235(2) (d). Therefore, your request will be granted, denied, or granted in part and denied in part on or before March 19, 2025.

Your request is being handled by Devin Farrelly. If you have questions regarding your request, or if you did not provide an email address in your request, please forward it to Devin Farrelly at farrellyd@detroitmi.gov<mailto:farrellyd@detroitmi.gov> to provide you a response more readily than by regular mail or fax. Mail and fax are not preferred at this time since they both require in-office support. We thank you in advance for your understanding.






Jack Dietrich, Supervising Assistant Corporation Counsel City of Detroit Law Department

313-237-5030



This communication, along with any attachments, is intended only for the use of the addressee and contains legally privileged and confidential information.  If you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any dissemination, distribution or copying of any information contained in, or attached to this communication, is strictly prohibited and you are requested to contact the sender for instructions to return the document.

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Minnich communications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All communications sent to and from Police Chief Dennis Minnich from January 28, 2025 through February 28, 2025. If this request is processed prior to February 28, please provide all communications through the date this request is processed. 

Records responsive to this request include all emails, recorded phone calls, and text messages related to government business and police department operations, including but not limited to all communications to and from the public, members of the town Select Board, and fellow officers. 

In order to better refine this request, your office may begin by providing metadata for communications sent to and from Chief Minnich, meaning a list (it can be a screen capture) of the name of the sender/interlocutor, the subject line of the email, and the date on which it was sent or received. Once this has been received, our team will provide an updated description for this request.

As required by archival regulations and the Massachusetts Public Records Law, please preserve all communications sent and received during this period, including all text messages, internal chats, and any other form of conversation.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Beryl Lipton

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Evergreen Solutions
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Subject: Request for Public Records - Alvin Community College



 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you. 
 
Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook
 
I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:
 
How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?
 
For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable) 
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held 
Pay Grade 
Pay Ranges (Min& Max) 
Current Step (if on a step plan) 
Contract Length (in days and/or months) 
Annual Base Salary with no additives 
Annual Salary with any additives 
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent) 


Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available: 
 
Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)  
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements 
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?                           
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks 
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan 
Overload Rates 
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs  
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline?  If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size?  If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution?  If yes, please provide details.
 
I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.
 
Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.
 
I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes



Evergreen Solutions

 

Very Respectfully,

 

Alisia Rios, MSIOP

Data Analyst – She/Her

 

Evergreen Solutions, LLC

2528 Barrington Circle Unit 201

Tallahassee, FL 32308

 

Office:   (850) 383-0111

Cell:       (850) 661-0341

Email:    alisia@consultevergreen.com

Partnering with public-sector clients to effect positive change

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request: Evergreen Solutions
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Jennifer Cronkhite at my office received the below request. Our office is a private law firm representing educational institutions. However, we are not the officer for public information at any of those institutions and cannot accept public information requests on their behalf.

Please submit your request to Alvin Community College. I believe you can do so by clicking “Request for Public Information” at the following link: https://www.alvincollege.edu/about/consumer-information/index.html. The College may handle the request internally or ask for our assistance.

I hope this answers any questions. Please let me know if I can assist you further.

---

Kyle Stone

title: Immigration Judge Zol Rainey"All Remands from Board of Immigration Appeals"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Immigration Judge Zol Rainey"All Remands from Board of Immigration Appeals"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The decisions issued by the Board of Immigration Appeals from December 2021 until the date of processing of this request, arising from cases decided by Immigration Judge Zol Damon Rainey, that were administratively closed, reversed, background check remand, and/or remand (including remands to a different IJ).

I would request any printouts, summaries, spreadsheets, reports, or other records or datasets that may encompass or address how many of removal orders included a negative credibility determination for any Respondent(s) for whom IJ Rainey issued removal orders in protection/form I-589 cases (in other words, decisions on Asylum, Wittholding of Removal, or Relief under the Convention Against Torture), after merits/individual hearings occurred, between December 2021 and the date of processing of this request.

All correspondence or communications in any medium (including but not limited to any email, fax, letter, text/SMS/MMS, memorandum, voicemail, audio recording, sticky-note, or any attachment thereto, and any conversion of any of the foregoing from a digital to analog form/format, or vice-versa) to or from IJ Rainey, from December 2021 through present time, regarding removal or any other immigration proceedings, containing the words "credibility," "credible," "incredible," "incoherent," "demeanor," "candor," "evasive," "non-responsive," "responsiveness," "inconsistent," "consistent," "consistency," "facial expression(s)," "body language," "standard language," or "addendum of law," or any abbreviation, contraction, misspelling, pluralization, or paraphrase thereof.

Copies of each and every "standard language addendum of law" or any substantially similar 'boilerplate' or 'template' document utilized by IJ Rainey as an exhibit in, as an attachment to, or as a drafting aid for any merits decision in a protection/form I-589 matter.

The requested records will be made available to the general public via a FOIA records clearinghouse, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes; rather, the results will be disseminated to interested individuals free of charge, and with no pecuniary gain to the Requestor, who is not the subject of any of these records. Thus, we would request that fees be waived.

Please search all records regarding agency business. You may not exclude searches of files or emails in the personal custody of your officials, such as personal email accounts. Records of official business conducted using unofficial systems or stored outside of official files is subject to the Federal Records Act and FOIA. It is not adequate to rely on policies and procedures that require officials to move such information to official systems within a certain period of time; I exercise and specifically preserve and assert my right to records contained in those files even if material has not yet been moved to official systems or if officials have, through negligence or willfulness, failed to meet their obligations.

If it is your position that any portion of the requested records is exempt from disclosure, I request that you provide an index of those documents as required under Vaughn v. Rosen, describe each document claimed as exempt with sufficient specificity to determine whether it should be exempt under FOIA, and discuss the consequences of disclosing, specifically identifying the reasons why a particular exemption is relevant and correlating those claims with the particular part of a withheld document to which they apply.

If it is your position that a record contains non-exempt segments, but that those non-exempt segments are so dispersed throughout the document as to make segregation impossible, please state what portion of the document is non-exempt, and how the material is dispersed throughout the document. If a request is denied in whole, please state specifically that it is not reasonable to segregate portions of the record for release.

You should institute a preservation hold on information responsive to this request. I intend to pursue all legal avenues to enforce my right of access under the FOIA, including litigation if that becomes necessary. Accordingly, the EOIR is on notice that litigation is reasonably foreseeable.

If it will accelerate release of responsive records to me, please also provide responsive material on a rolling basis.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely yours,

Derrick J. Hensley

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Derrick Hensley

title: Connecticut Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities (CHRO)

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Connecticut Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities (CHRO)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

FOIA Request to the Connecticut Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities (CHRO)
📌 Address:
Connecticut Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities (CHRO)
450 Columbus Blvd, Suite 2
Hartford, CT 06103


📌 Subject: Freedom of Information Act Request – Expedited Processing & ADA Accommodations Requested

Dear FOIA Officer,

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act (Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-200, et seq.), I request expedited processing and ADA accommodations for the following records:

Records Requested:
All records, communications, and case files related to CHRO Case #2510183, including but not limited to:

Internal communications between CHRO officials discussing this case.
Communications between CHRO and the Connecticut Office of the Attorney General.
Communications between CHRO and the Connecticut Department of Consumer Protection (DCP) regarding this case.
Any records related to ADA enforcement actions, decisions, or internal deliberations about CHRO Case #2510183.
All emails, memos, and written correspondence from January 1, 2024, to present discussing:

ADA Title II enforcement and compliance within CHRO investigations.
Whistleblower complaints related to disability rights enforcement.
Denials of accommodations for individuals with disabilities within CHRO’s jurisdiction.
All policies, procedures, or internal guidance used by CHRO when handling ADA complaints, disability discrimination cases, or whistleblower retaliation claims involving state agencies.

Any CHRO reports, memos, or correspondence sent to federal oversight agencies (DOJ, HHS OCR, EEOC) regarding ADA violations or CHRO Case #2510183.

Request for Expedited Processing:
I request expedited processing under Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d) due to:

The urgent public interest in ensuring CHRO is properly enforcing ADA protections.
Ongoing legal proceedings in CHRO Case #2510183, where delays in obtaining this information could impact my ability to seek justice.
Evidence of government suppression of civil rights enforcement and whistleblower retaliation, necessitating immediate federal review.
Please confirm expedited processing and provide an estimated date for the production of these records.

Request for ADA Accommodations:
As a person with a disability protected under the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act, I require the following non-negotiable accommodations:
✅ Electronic Only Communication – All records and responses must be provided in the body of the message and as PDF attachments. No physical mail or portal logins are permitted.
✅ Simplified Summaries for Complex Records – Any highly technical or complex documents must include a plain-language summary to ensure accessibility.
✅ Identification of Responsible Personnel – The names, titles, and contact information of the individuals handling this request must be provided.
✅ Detailed Justifications for Redactions or Denials – If any records are withheld, I require a full legal explanation under Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-210(b), with specific statutory citations.

If any accommodation is denied, please provide a written explanation and cite the specific legal basis for non-compliance under ADA Title II (42 U.S.C. § 12132) and Section 504 (29 U.S.C. § 794).

Delivery Format:
I request that the records be provided in electronic format to ensure accessibility. If this request is denied in whole or in part, please cite the specific legal exemption(s) and provide an index of withheld documents.

Please confirm receipt of this request within four business days and provide an estimated timeline for completion.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros 
ABI Resources

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS
